heading: murder at the vatican
subheading: a member of the pope's swiss guard apparently killed the elite unit's new commander, the commander's wife, and then himself monday. cedrich tornay, 23, was angry that he would not be decorated at a swearing-in ceremony wednesday, a papal spokesman said, and was also upset that col. alois estermann had reprimanded him for staying out all night. hours before the murder, estermann, 43, was appointed to head the corps, founded in 1506.
author: wired staff
